item.title: Mount Rushmore and Black Hills Tour with Two Meals and a Music Variety Show
item.description: Visit Mount Rushmore with a pro on this guided tour to the national monument from Rapid City. Not only does this tour let you skip the hairpin turns and packed parking lot leading to your visit, but you also get to learn the history of the iconic site from your guide. After, continue exploring Black Hills sights including the Crazy Horse Monument, Iron Mountain Road, Sylvan Lake, and more.

image.alt: Mount Rushmore and Black Hills Tour with Two Meals and a Music Variety Show

item.title: Bus Tour of Mount Rushmore and the Black Hills
item.description: Discover some of South Dakota’s top landmarks—including the iconic Mt. Rushmore—and leave the driving to someone else on this seamless, full-day bus tour. Meet in the morning in Rapid City, hop aboard your air-conditioned coach, and head to Mt. Rushmore to see the larger-than-life sculpture. Next, drive through the Black Hills, stop for lunch (own expense) in Custer State Park, thread the Needles Highway, see the Crazy Horse Memorial, and more.

image.alt: Bus Tour of Mount Rushmore and the Black Hills

item.title: Premiere Private Black Hills Tour: Mt Rushmore, Crazy Horse & Custer State Park
item.description: Maximize your time in South Dakota by seeing Black Hills’ highlights all in one day. An air-conditioned vehicle loaded with snacks takes you to famous carved monuments Mt. Rushmore and Crazy Horse Memorial, as well through some of Custer Park’s 71,000 scenic acres. You might even spot resident bison, elk, and other wildlife. There are also stops at Sylvan Lake and Iron Mountain Road, for more Rushmore views.

image.alt: Premiere Private Black Hills Tour: Mt Rushmore, Crazy Horse & Custer State Park

item.title: Private Tour of Mount Rushmore, Crazy Horse and Custer State Park
item.description: Don't bother renting a car or planning a thing with this private tour to three celebrated South Dakota monuments: Mount Rushmore National Memorial, the Crazy Horse Memorial, and Custer State Park. After a hassle-free pickup from your hotel, your personal guide transports you to these three landmarks. You visit each attraction—with entry fees included—and learn more as you go with the help of your guide's expert commentary.

image.alt: Private Tour of Mount Rushmore, Crazy Horse and Custer State Park

item.title: Mt Rushmore "Bundle" - w/Crazy Horse/Needles/Iron Mtn-Public
item.description: Visit Mount Rushmore and Crazy Horse monuments on a small-group tour. Stop along the way to look for wild buffalo and take photos, enjoy a picnic lunch at Sylvan Lake, and visit Custer State Park where you can look out for wildlife like antelope, prairie dogs, and elk. This tour is ideal for visitors wanting to travel at their own pace and learn about some of the nation’s most famous monuments.

image.alt: Mt Rushmore "Bundle" - w/Crazy Horse/Needles/Iron Mtn-Public

item.title: Private Black Hills Monument Package
item.description: Discover the landmarks of South Dakota during this full-day excursion from Rapid City. Alongside a private guide, visit the iconic Mouth Rushmore, where you can enjoy a hike, as well as the Crazy Horse Memorial. You also visit Custer State Park where you have the opportunity to examine the flora and fauna of the area such as bison, antelope, elk, and bighorn sheep.

image.alt: Private Black Hills Monument Package

item.title: Rushmore Quest: Black Hills Parks & Peaks
item.description: Discover the best of South Dakota with your own tour guide on this excursion from Rapid City. Spend your day observing local wildlife like American Bison, bighorn sheep, and antelope at Custer State Park. Then, visit the iconic Mount Rushmore before finishing at the unfinished Crazy Horse Memorial that pays tribute to the Native American warrior.

image.alt: Rushmore Quest: Black Hills Parks & Peaks

item.title: Day trip of the Black Hills: Mount Rushmore to Custer State Park!
item.description: Neal and Becky live in the Black Hills near the historic mining town of Hayward. Neal is a native South Dakotan having a close association with the Black Hills since his youth. As you tour the southern Black Hills, you'll get a narration of the history of the sights as well as personal stories of the area. They love people and have a desire to serve you to make your visit an enjoyable one. Suggestions and tips on how to make your stay more enjoyable freely offered!

image.alt: Day trip of the Black Hills: Mount Rushmore to Custer State Park!

item.title: Private Badlands National Park Day Tour
item.description: Badlands National Park is a huge park that can be intimidating if you’re thinking about exploring it on your own. Instead, book this Badlands National Park Private Full-Day Tour from Rapid City and follow a guide through the most beautiful areas of the park. With many stops incorporated, you’ll spot wildlife and fossils and go for a hike. Lunch and a visit to the Minuteman Missile Visitors Center are included.

image.alt: Private Badlands National Park Day Tour

item.title: Nature's Glow: Badlands Sunset & Wildlife Tour
item.description: If you have a limited amount of time to explore Badlands National Park, prebook this Badlands National Park Private Tour from Rapid City that’s perfect for travelers short on time. Your own private group goes with a guide who knows the area well, and teaches you about the culture, geology, wildlife, and land. You’ll also stop at Badlands Wall to see the stunning sunset.

image.alt: Nature's Glow: Badlands Sunset & Wildlife Tour

item.title: Badlands Premium Van Tour - Public
item.description: There’s nothing “bad” about touring the Badlands with a guide who’ll drive you to the national park, teach you the history of the area, and make sure you don’t miss any of the best spots for photos. The tour is a highly curated route that takes you to places you’d otherwise miss. From scenic overlooks to the famous Wall Drug Store, and even to the Minuteman Missile National Historic Site, where you’ll get to experience ‘duck and cover drills,’ it’s good fun in the Badlands.

image.alt: Badlands Premium Van Tour - Public

item.title: Private Badlands Package
item.description: Explore one of South Dakota’s incredible national parks and other highlights with this day tour from Rapid City to Badlands National Park. Your private guide will share their expertise about the region’s history, geology, and more as you drive through the beautiful park, possibly spotting wildlife like buffalo. You’ll have lunch a local restaurant of your choice, stop at famous roadside store/attraction Wall Drugs, the ghost town of Scenic, and the Minuteman Missile Site.

image.alt: Private Badlands Package

item.title: Western Horizons Hot Air Balloon rides
item.description: Soar over the Southern Black Hills and expansive prairies of South Dakota when you embark on this thrilling hot-air balloon ride from Hot Springs. Climb aboard your private hot-air balloon and enjoy unparalleled views of the area. Upon touchdown, enjoy a celebratory sparkling wine toast with nibbles and receive a personalized flight certificate.

image.alt: Western Horizons Hot Air Balloon rides

item.title: Buffalo Hunt Coaster Single Ride in South Dakota
item.description: This admission ticket grants a ride on the one-of-a-kind Buffalo Hunt Roller Coaster in Fort Hayes near Rapid City. Soar over a herd of fiberglass “buffalo” targets on the roller coaster and shoot as many as you can. The ride swings in the air from side to side making the “hunt” more challenging and your aim more difficult.

image.alt: Buffalo Hunt Coaster Single Ride in South Dakota

item.title: Mt Rushmore + Black Hills Sunset & Stargazing
item.description: Hop aboard 'Buff,' a Jeep Wrangler specially modified to resist excited bison, with this private tour through Custer State Park. You'll visit all corners of the park, including Mt. Coolidge, Iron Mountain Road, Needles Highway, Sylvan Lake, and the Custer State Park Wildlife Loop, with a stop along the way for a picnic lunch served with beer/wine (on request) at Stockade Lake.

image.alt: Mt Rushmore + Black Hills Sunset & Stargazing

item.title: Evening Enchantment: Badlands Sunset & Stargazing
item.description: See a different side of Badlands National Park, at sunset and under the night sky, with this experience. Your guide will take you and your party out at dusk, a great time to spot wildlife. After the sun sets, you'll head over to the park ranger-led Night Sky Program, where you'll learn about the universe and maybe even get to see the sky through a telescope.

image.alt: Evening Enchantment: Badlands Sunset & Stargazing

item.title: Majestic Landscapes: Badlands, Wall Drug, and Agate Hunts
item.description: Delve into this beautiful corner of South Dakota with a private, expertly guided tour from Rapid City to Badlands National Park and Buffalo Gap National Grassland to see the agate fields, plus stop in the historic ghost town of Scenic and at the famous roadside attraction of Wall Drugs. At Badlands your guide will drive the Badlands Loop, stop at the Ben Reifel Visitor Center, and take you to the best overlooks and viewpoints before driving you back to your accommodations in Rapid City.

image.alt: Majestic Landscapes: Badlands, Wall Drug, and Agate Hunts

item.title: Bike Adventure on the Mickelson Trail - Private
item.description: The 109-mile Mickelson Trail makes for an epic way to experience the beauty of South Dakota’s Black Hills. With this private tour, you’ll be able to choose your distance, place, and time—bike the whole trail or stick to a segment, like the scenic 22.5 miles from Rochford to Hill City. Everything’s customizable on this tour, your guide handling all arrangements and transport so you can focus on adventure.

image.alt: Bike Adventure on the Mickelson Trail - Private

item.title: Private Tour of the Badlands with Local Experts
item.description: Don’t get crammed into a huge tour with travelers you don’t know—instead, prebook this Badlands National Park Private Tour and visit the national park with a private group. Make additional stops at South Dakota’s Museum of Geology, Wall Drug Store, and Minuteman Missile Visitors Center, as well as the national park. You choose what you’ll do or have your guide plan the day for you.

image.alt: Private Tour of the Badlands with Local Experts

item.title: Private Half Day Mt Rushmore & Black Hills Tour
item.description: Make exploring the Black Hills’ many sights effortless with this private half-day tour. Picked up from your Rapid City hotel by your personal driver/guide, you’ll wander amongst giant Presidents—Mount Rushmore, that is—traverse the spectacular Needles Highway, gaze upon Sylvan Lake, witness the wildlife of Custer State Park, and more. With no worries about driving, navigation, or parking, you’ll be free to relax, take pictures, and enjoy the view.

image.alt: Private Half Day Mt Rushmore & Black Hills Tour

item.title: Spirit of the West: Devils Tower, Spearfish Canyon & Deadwood
item.description: Check out the natural wonders of Devils Tower, Spearfish Canyon, and Northern Black Hills on this private adventure, where all the details are taken care of for you, so you won’t have any hassles along the way. This is a full day tour that starts with hotel pickup and includes either a picnic lunch if the weather is good, or else a meal in a local restaurant to keep you energized for the tour.

image.alt: Spirit of the West: Devils Tower, Spearfish Canyon & Deadwood

item.title: Roller Coaster Tickets with Dinner and Show in Rapid City
item.description: For an action-packed, family-friendly adventure in the Black Hills—that covers dinner—look no further than this three-in-one adventure. First things first: You’ll ride a roller coaster, your six-shooter in hand to nab the most buffalo targets along the zig-zagging way. After the thrills, it’s time for a fresh chuckwagon dinner and a Branson-style variety show, your favorite songs accompanying every bite.

image.alt: Roller Coaster Tickets with Dinner and Show in Rapid City

item.title: Badlands National Park by Bicycle - Private
item.description: With nothing but lunar landscapes for miles, Badlands National Park makes for a wild cycling journey—for beginner and advanced cyclists alike. On this guided trip, you’ll pedal nearly 30 miles along the moderate Badlands Loop Road, from vista to vista and across millions of years, breaking for a provided picnic lunch along the way. Watch for wildlife, take in the views, and feel the energy of this sacred place.

image.alt: Badlands National Park by Bicycle - Private

item.title: Devil's Tower - Deadwood - Spearfish Canyon Waterfalls + Picnic
item.description: Visit Devils Tower National Monument and the surrounding area with a professional guide with this tour. You'll make plenty of stops along the way at spots such as the Old Fort Meade Museum, Bear Butte State Park, and the Geographic Center of the Nation Monument, while your guide tells you all about the region's history.

image.alt: Devil's Tower - Deadwood - Spearfish Canyon Waterfalls + Picnic
